00045 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00046  * @brief Deinitialize the HT_DACn peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00047  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00048  * @retval None
00049  ************************************************************************************************************/
00050 void DAC_DeInit(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn)
00051 {
00052   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00053 
00054   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00055   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00056 
00057   if (HT_DACn == HT_DAC0)
00058   {
00059     RSTCUReset.Bit.DAC0 = 1;
00060   }
00061   #if (LIBCFG_DAC1)
00062   else if (HT_DACn == HT_DAC1)
00063   {
00064     RSTCUReset.Bit.DAC1 = 1;
00065   }
00066   #endif
00067   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00068 }
00069 
00070 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00071  * @brief Configure the DAC conversion mode.
00072  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00073  * @param ModeSel: specify the conversion mode
00074  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00075  *     @arg ASYNC_MODE : asynchronous conversion mode
00076  *     @arg SYNC_MODE  : synchronous conversion mode
00077  * @retval None
00078  ************************************************************************************************************/
00079 void DAC_ModeConfig(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 ModeSel)
00080 {
00081   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00082   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00083   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CONVERSION_MODE(ModeSel));
00084 
00085   HT_DACn->CFGR = ModeSel;
00086 }
00087 
00088 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00089  * @brief Configure the specified DAC channel reference voltage.
00090  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00091  * @param DAC_Ch: the DAC channel to configure
00092 *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00093 *     @arg DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
00094 *     @arg DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
00095  * @param RefSel: DAC reference voltage source
00096  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00097  *     @arg DAC_REFERENCE_VDDA : VDDA
00098  *     @arg DAC_REFERENCE_VREF : VREF
00099  * @retval None
00100  ************************************************************************************************************/
00101 void DAC_ReferenceConfig(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 DAC_Ch, u32 RefSel)
00102 {
00103   HT_DACCH_TypeDef *DACnCH = (HT_DACCH_TypeDef *)((u32)&HT_DACn->DACCH0 + DAC_Ch * 8 * 4);
00104 
00105   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00106   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00107   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CHANNEL(DAC_Ch));
00108   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_REFERENCE(RefSel));
00109 
00110   DACnCH->CR = (DACnCH->CR & ~(3UL << 14)) | RefSel;
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00114  * @brief Configure the specified DAC channel resolution.
00115  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00116  * @param DAC_Ch: the DAC channel to configure
00117 *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00118 *     @arg DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
00119 *     @arg DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
00120  * @param ResoSel: DAC Channel Resolution
00121  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00122  *     @arg DAC_RESOLUTION_8BIT  : 8-bit resolution
00123  *     @arg DAC_RESOLUTION_12BIT : 12-bit resolution
00124  * @retval None
00125  ************************************************************************************************************/
00126 void DAC_ResolutionConfig(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 DAC_Ch, u32 ResoSel)
00127 {
00128   HT_DACCH_TypeDef *DACnCH = (HT_DACCH_TypeDef *)((u32)&HT_DACn->DACCH0 + DAC_Ch * 8 * 4);
00129 
00130   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00131   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00132   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CHANNEL(DAC_Ch));
00133   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_RESOLUTION(ResoSel));
00134 
00135   DACnCH->CR = (DACnCH->CR & ~(1UL << 2)) | ResoSel;
00136 }
00137 
00138 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00139  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified DAC Channel output buffer.
00140  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00141  * @param DAC_Ch: the DAC channel to configure
00142 *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00143 *     @arg DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
00144 *     @arg DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
00145  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00146  * @retval None
00147  ************************************************************************************************************/
00148 void DAC_OutBufCmd(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 DAC_Ch, ControlStatus NewState)
00149 {
00150   HT_DACCH_TypeDef *DACnCH = (HT_DACCH_TypeDef *)((u32)&HT_DACn->DACCH0 + DAC_Ch * 8 * 4);
00151 
00152   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00153   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00154   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CHANNEL(DAC_Ch));
00155   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00156 
00157   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00158   {
00159     DACnCH->CR = (DACnCH->CR & ~(3UL << 6)) | (2UL << 6);
00160   }
00161   else
00162   {
00163     DACnCH->CR = (DACnCH->CR & ~(3UL << 6)) | (1UL << 6);
00164   }
00165 }
00166 
00167 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00168  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified DAC channel.
00169  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00170  * @param DAC_Ch: the DAC channel to configure
00171 *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00172 *     @arg DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
00173 *     @arg DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
00174  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00175  * @retval None
00176  ************************************************************************************************************/
00177 void DAC_Cmd(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 DAC_Ch, ControlStatus NewState)
00178 {
00179   HT_DACCH_TypeDef *DACnCH = (HT_DACCH_TypeDef *)((u32)&HT_DACn->DACCH0 + DAC_Ch * 8 * 4);
00180 
00181   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00182   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00183   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CHANNEL(DAC_Ch));
00184   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00185 
00186   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00187   {
00188     SetBit_BB((u32)&DACnCH->CR, 0);
00189   }
00190   else
00191   {
00192     ResetBit_BB((u32)&DACnCH->CR, 0);
00193   }
00194 }
00195 
00196 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00197  * @brief Set the data holding register value for the specified DAC channel.
00198  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00199  * @param DAC_Ch: the DAC channel to configure
00200 *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00201 *     @arg DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
00202 *     @arg DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
00203  * @param Data: next conversion data.
00204  * @retval None
00205  ************************************************************************************************************/
00206 void DAC_SetData(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 DAC_Ch, u32 Data)
00207 {
00208   HT_DACCH_TypeDef *DACnCH = (HT_DACCH_TypeDef *)((u32)&HT_DACn->DACCH0 + DAC_Ch * 8 * 4);
00209 
00210   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00211   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00212   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CHANNEL(DAC_Ch));
00213 
00214   DACnCH->DHR = Data;
00215 }
00216 
00217 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00218  * @brief Return the data output register value of the specified DAC channel.
00219  * @param HT_DACn: where HT_DACn is the selected DAC from the DAC peripherals.
00220  * @param DAC_Ch: the DAC channel to configure
00221 *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00222 *     @arg DAC_CH0 : DAC channel 0
00223 *     @arg DAC_CH1 : DAC channel 1
00224  * @return The selected DAC channel data output value.
00225  ************************************************************************************************************/
00226 u16 DAC_GetOutData(HT_DAC_TypeDef* HT_DACn, u8 DAC_Ch)
00227 {
00228   HT_DACCH_TypeDef *DACnCH = (HT_DACCH_TypeDef *)((u32)&HT_DACn->DACCH0 + DAC_Ch * 8 * 4);
00229 
00230   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00231   Assert_Param(IS_DAC(HT_DACn));
00232   Assert_Param(IS_DAC_CHANNEL(DAC_Ch));
00233 
00234   return ((u16)DACnCH->DOR);
00235 }
